intro: Psychotria giorgii, commonly known as the Colombian psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria giorgii is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
